content.question: For time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a particle moves with velocity vector given by <math alttext="v of, t, equals, open angled bracket, f of t, comma g of t, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are continuous functions of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the particle is at position <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 4, comma 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions gives the particle’s position at time <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 times f of 3, comma negative 2 times g of 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 4 minus 2 times f of 3, comma 5 minus 2 times g of 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the integral from, 1 to 3, of, f of t, d t, comma the integral from, 1 to 3, of, g of t, d t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 4, minus the integral from, 1 to 3, of, f of t, d t, comma 5 minus the integral from, 1 to 3, of, g of t, d t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 4, minus the integral from, 1 to 3, of, f of t, d t, comma 5 minus the integral from, 1 to 3, of, g of t, d t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
